page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: Apart from woodland almost the whole project area is given over to farming. The farms vary considerably in size. The largest farm, in the centre of the area, is a mixed farm of 1200 acres, 200 acres down to grass, and 1000 acres arable; 200 acres of peas, 400 acres of wheat and 400 acres of barley. 200 bullocks have been bought in, fattened on barley, and sold.It is significant that there are no dairy cattle on this farm.This particular farm specializes in raising racehorces even buying them in from New Zealand. The farm employs four full time men and two part time men. The racehorses keep up to twenty people employed, according to the season. Other farms in the area are generally mixed, although some concentrate on pigs or sheep. It is interesting to note the decline in dairy farming.
